snippet: Raymond Felton struggled in Portland but is happy to be back in New York, where he thrived in then-coach Mike D’Antoni’s up-tempo system.
abstract: Point guard Raymond Felton, who struggled with the Portland Trail Blazers last season, is excited to be back in New York, where he thrived under former coach Mike D'Antoni; Felton's return, in a three-year deal that will pay him $10 million, helped set the stage for the departure of Jeremy Lin.
lead_paragraph: Raymond Felton struggled in Portland but is happy to be back in New York, where he thrived in then-coach Mike D’Antoni’s up-tempo system.

headline.seo: New York Knicks Hoping the Old Raymond Felton Returns
headline.main: Knicks Can Only Hope That Felton’s Last Year Was an Ugly Aberration
headline.print_headline: Wondering If Last Year Was a Blip For Felton
